1.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

2.text: Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, even by reason of my haste that is in me.

3.text: I have heard the reproof which putteth me to shame, and the spirit of my understanding answereth me.

4.text: Knowest thou not this of old time, since man was placed upon earth,

5.text: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the godless but for a moment?

6.text: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;

7.text: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where is he?

8.text: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.

9.text: The eye which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.

10.text: His children shall seek the favour of the poor, and his hands shall give back his wealth.

11.text: His bones are full of his youth, but it shall lie down with him in the dust.

12.text: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue;

13.text: Though he spare it, and will not let it go, but keep it still within his mouth;

14.text: Yet his meat in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.

15.text: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

16.text: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viperâ€™s tongue shall slay him.

17.text: He shall not look upon the rivers, the flowing streams of honey and butter.

18.text: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down; according to the substance that he hath gotten, he shall not rejoice.

19.text: For he hath oppressed and forsaken the poor; he hath violently taken away an house, and he shall not build it up.

20.text: Because he knew no quietness within him, he shall not save aught of that wherein he delighteth.

21.text: There was nothing left that he devoured not; therefore his prosperity shall not endure.

22.text: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: the hand of every one that is in misery shall come upon him.

23.text: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fierceness of his wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.

24.text: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of brass shall strike him through.

25.text: He draweth it forth, and it cometh out of his body: yea, the glittering point cometh out of his gall; terrors are upon him.

26.text: All darkness is laid up for his treasures: a fire not blown by man shall devour him; it shall consume that which is left in his tent.

27.text: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, and the earth shall rise up against him.

28.text: The increase of his house shall depart, his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

29.text: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.
